title: Enhancing Non-Cognitive Competencies through Digital Music Education: A Set-Theoretic Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Proficiency in Basic Digital Tools and Experience in Music Education
context.additional_context: Project-based learning in constrained technological environments utilizing smartphones as the primary tool

learning_goals: Learners can propose a combination of three or more strategies that integrate cognitive and non-cognitive outcomes when designing digital music education environments.

Learners can explain procedures for analyzing interactions among educational design elements using NCA ( Necessary Condition Analysis) and fsQCA (fuzzy-set Qualitative Comparative Analysis) methodologies.
Learners can distinguish at least two affective-activating elements for enhancing self-efficacy (SE) and two competence-activating elements for strengthening internal control (IE), respectively.

resources: Digital Music Production App (e.g., GarageBand, FL Studio Mobile)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
